page.title: 04A Minister in Jersey
page.content: Reverend Farley of Sion Methodist Church has been in Jersey nearly three years. He says it is different from his old home in Derbyshire in the Pennines. He told us that his busiest day is Sunday. The size of the congregation varies every week. Reverend Farley said the average size of his congregation is about 65 - 80 people that is including 30 children. Certain services have more people such as, harvest, anniversary, carols and family. He told us that he spends his weekdays visiting the sick in hospital and homes. In the evening he does his paperwork and attends meetings. He did not have any other jobs before entering the church but he did a little farming. His father is also a Methodist minister.
